publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-4534 Alasdair Allan: Tagsa Uibhist—That the Parliament congratulates Tagsa Uibhist as it celebrates its first decade of providing a lifeline caring service to the people of Uist through helping those in the community to maintain their independence, offering a wide range of home-based support to many frail members of the community and providing respite care for carers; notes that from one member of staff providing nine hours of home support for carers 10 years ago, Tagsa Uibhist now employs 22 highly trained registered care staff, seven drivers and four office staff for the organisation’s 150 clients; welcomes the sense of dedication shown by Tagsa Uibhist in its achievements of serving and helping the people of Uist, and wishes Tagsa Uibhist all the best for the next 10 years to come. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Rob Gibson, Jamie McGrigor, Kenneth Gibson, Sandra White, Jackson Carlaw, Aileen Campbell, Bob Doris, Gil Paterson, Anne McLaughlin Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-4534 Tagsa Uibhist (lodged on 29 June 2009) Stuart McMillan*
